intro: Triuranthera brevipedunculata, commonly known as the short-stemmed triuranthera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged in a rosette pattern, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
